sentences.english: The Green Book was an exercise, if a daft one, in utopian totalitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 綠皮書就是烏托邦式的極權主義的拙劣預演。

sentences.english: "We were all stunned at how poor we were, " commented Brooking.
sentences.chinese: “我們都對我們拙劣的表現驚呆了，”布魯金評論到。

sentences.english: Your bad spelling may prejudice your chances of getting the job.
sentences.chinese: 拼寫拙劣會影響你獲得這個職位。

sentences.english: I guessed that the crude, scribbly letters had probably been written by a little boy.
sentences.chinese: 我猜，這拙劣潦草的字母很可能出自一個小男孩之手。

sentences.english: Wrap a Sir, I miss your original meaning probably unlikely inferior get such?
sentences.chinese: 包先生，我想你們的本意大概不致於拙劣得如此吧？

sentences.english: This is all hopeless twaddle that I am saying about her.
sentences.chinese: 我這樣說她，那是全無希望的拙劣廢話。

sentences.english: It's a prose style with all the ineptitudes filed away.
sentences.chinese: 這是一篇將所有拙劣之處修整過的散文體。

sentences.english: Students shouldn't spend much time reading mediocre paperbacks.
sentences.chinese: 學生不應花大量的時間讀拙劣的平裝書。

sentences.english: There's no way of estimating how many ‘botched’ boob jobs there are each year.
sentences.chinese: 沒法估計每年做了多少“拙劣的”隆胸手術。

sentences.english: The quality of the book is diluted by the bad writing.
sentences.chinese: 那本書的質量因文字拙劣而掉價了。

sentences.english: The critics were down on the author as an absurd bungler .
sentences.chinese: 評論家把那位作家攻擊爲荒謬的拙劣作者。

sentences.english: The awfully  awkward warship is warned not to be  awarded war  reward.
sentences.chinese: 那艘非常拙劣的軍艦受到不給予戰爭報酬的警告。

sentences.english: His clumsy tongue had finally forced this foolish confession past the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 他那拙劣的舌頭總算把這份愚蠢的供詞擠出了牙縫。

sentences.english: The bridge collapsed after a botched attempt to rebuild it.
sentences.chinese: 在企圖以拙劣的手法重建那座橋時，橋崩塌了。

sentences.english: The poorly designed bridge needs remedial work to make it safe.
sentences.chinese: 這座設計拙劣的橋需要做補救工作，以確保它的安全。

definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
Gaoming district of Foshan city 佛山市[Fo2 shan1 shi4], Guangdong
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
